intro: Pholidota nervosa, commonly known as the narrow-veined pholidota, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including countries such as Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with prominent venation patterns. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Pholidota nervosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
